semantic_title: Secondary Diabetes Mellitus Due to Pancreatectomy Coding
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 4. Chapter 4: Endocrine, Nutritional and Metabolic Diseases > a. Diabetes mellitus > 4. Assigning and sequencing secondary diabetes codes and its causes > (i) Secondary diabetes mellitus due to pancreatectomy

content.full_text: For postpancreatectomy diabetes mellitus (lack of insulin due to the surgical removal of all or part of the pancreas), assign code E89.1, Postprocedural hypoinsulinemia. Assign a code from category E13 as the principal or first-listed diagnosis and a code from subcategory Z90.41, Acquired absence of pancreas, as an additional code. (Evidence: pg no: 42, L8-L11)
content.summary: Provides specific coding instructions for diabetes resulting from pancreatic surgery, requiring multiple codes including E89.1, E13 category, and Z90.41 (Evidence: pg no: 42, L8-L11)
key_concepts: Postpancreatectomy diabetes mellitus (Evidence: pg no: 42, L8)
Multiple code assignment requirement (Evidence: pg no: 42, L9-L11)
Principal diagnosis sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 42, L9-L10)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign E89.1 for postprocedural hypoinsulinemia (Evidence: pg no: 42, L9)
detailed_rules.explanation: This code captures the postprocedural complication of insulin deficiency following pancreatic surgery (Evidence: pg no: 42, L8-L9)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign E13 category code as principal or first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 42, L9-L10)
detailed_rules.explanation: The diabetes condition takes precedence in sequencing for postpancreatectomy cases (Evidence: pg no: 42, L9-L10)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Z90.41 as additional code for acquired absence of pancreas (Evidence: pg no: 42, L10-L11)
detailed_rules.explanation: This code documents the anatomical status following pancreatic removal (Evidence: pg no: 42, L10-L11)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Assign E89.1 for postprocedural hypoinsulinemia
Step 3: Assign appropriate E13 code as principal/first-listed
Step 4: Add Z90.41 for acquired absence of pancreas

correct_coding.sequencing: E13 code first, then E89.1, then Z90.41
correct_coding.rationale: E13 is principal diagnosis, E89.1 captures the postprocedural complication, Z90.41 documents anatomical status (Evidence: pg no: 42, L8-L11)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Missing the diabetes code and anatomical status code
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only the postprocedural complication code

warnings: Must use all three code types for complete coding (Evidence: pg no: 42, L8-L11)
best_practices: Sequence E13 category code as principal or first-listed (Evidence: pg no: 42, L9-L10)

tips: Remember all three components: diabetes, postprocedural complication, and anatomical status
clinical_context: Applies to both total and partial pancreatectomy when diabetes results
